data.name: What is Ludo?
data.part1: Ludo is a game that is typically played with 4 players. Each player has 4 pieces that they move around the board. The aim of the game is to move all of your pieces to the home square. Ludo game is often played with friends and family.
data.part2: Whether you play Ludo online or offline, the game’s objective is to move the player’s tokens clockwise around the board, up the home column, and into the Home. However, depending upon the gameplay and rules, the player needs to strategize their move.For instance, when you play the classic Ludo board game, you must roll a six to move a token out of the base and onto the start position. This rule changes when it comes to playing Ludo online. Ludo games like Ludo Supreme, where all the tokens are in the open position, and you do not need to roll a six to start the game.

data.name: History of Ludo Game
data.part1: Ludo is a game that is believed to have originated in India. It finds its origin in the Indian game, Pachisi, which was played around the 6th century. Ludo has evolved from Pachisi and the first recorded game of Ludo was in the year 1896. The earliest evidence of this game’s evolution in India is the depiction of boards on the caves of Ellora.
data.part2: The original version is also described in the Indian epic Mahabharata and is known as Charūparṇī. Shakuni uses cursed dice to beat the Pandavas, and at last after losing everything including their wife Draupadi, Yudhisthira plays the game for their freedom.

data.name: Why is Ludo so Popular?
data.part1: Ludo is a very popular game because it can be enjoyed by players of all ages. The game is simple to understand and can be played quickly. The game can also be enjoyed by a large number of players. Ludo is particularly popular in India as it can be played on family occasions
data.part2: With technological advancement, Ludo is not just a board game but can be played online as well. You simply need a device with an internet connection and you can start playing with players from all over the world.

data.name: Countries that play Ludo game
data.part1: Ludo is popular in countries such as India, the United Kingdom
data.part2: and the United States. You can also find players in Pakistan, Brazil, Australia, Venezuela, France, and Canada.

data.name: Who invented Ludo game?
data.part1: Ludo is a board game that was discovered in the 6th century in India. In the ancient era, it was known as Chaupar. Here are 9 other board games that were invented in India.
data.part2: Ludo is a board game that was discovered in the 6th century in India. In the ancient era, it was known as Chaupar. Here are 9 other board games that were invented in India.

data.name: How to play Ludo?
data.part1: You can play Ludo on a board with tokens or play three types of ludo online games on Zupee. The game’s objective is to move the player’s tokens clockwise around the board
data.part2: up the home column, and into the Home. However, the ludo online gameplay and rules are slightly different. Learn how to play Ludo in 5 easy steps!

data.name: How to play Ludo Online?
data.part1: You can play ludo online on Zupee with Ludo supreme, Ludo Ninja, and Ludo Turbo. All three games are an online version of the classic board game Ludo, with some tweaks to the gameplay
data.part2: For instance, Ludo Supreme is a timed game, whereas, in Ludo Ninja and Turbo, the player gets an equal number of moves to score maximum points.

data.name: How many times I can roll sixes?
data.part1: While playing ludo, you get an extra turn to roll a six
data.part2: However, if you roll six more than three times in one turn, you lose your turn.
